jade.core
Class Console

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  jade.core.Console
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
GConsole
public class Console
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.io.Serializable

Extends a JPanel to emulated a Console

See Also:
Serialized Form

                          ColoredChar ch)

buffCamera

public void buffCamera(Console.Camera camera)
Buffers everything the camera sees centered at the location specified in addCamera. If addCamera has not been called first, this will fail.

Specified by:
keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

getKey

public char getKey()
Returns the next key press. GetKey blocks for input.

tryGetKey

public char tryGetKey()
Returns the next key press if there is one, otherwise returns '\0' without blocking.

clearKeyBuffer

public void clearKeyBuffer()
Clears all the key events wainting to be used. Often useful after tryGetKey() so that new inputs can overide old key presses.

addMacro

public void addMacro(char key,
                     java.lang.String macro)
Maps a key to a macro. When ever the key is pressed, the macro will be put into the input buffer rather than the pressed keys. Note that macros are not recursive.

removeMacro

public void removeMacro(char key)
Removes any macros associated with the key.

refreshScreen

public void refreshScreen()
Refreshes the screen to reflect the buffer

exit

public void exit()
Calls System.exit(0);

copyState

public void copyState(Console console)
Copies the state of the console. This is useful if you need to open a serialized console.
